title: What are the disadvantages of wireless charging? - Quora

response.answer_text: Since Kenzi Mudge already covered the disadvantages (and you should read her response first), let’s flip it around to see why you might want to use wireless charging. Convenience is the main reason for a wireless charger. For now, it’s probably the only real reason as well. Once you have a charging pad or stand set up, it’s very convenient to simply put your phone on it to charge up. No fumbling with cords, or accidentally dragging something off a table if you forget to unplug the phone. While it’s still novel, the technology is getting better, and less expensive. With a newer Samsung device, you can take advantage of the higher power transfers (2A / 15W), compared with the iPhones and last gen gadgets (1A / 5W). We did a buyers guide / review on the Belkin charging pad, for your reference:Best 15W Wireless Charger Pad For Samsung Under $60 Cars in 2018/19 model years are now coming with wireless charging, which is a real convenience over needing another cord in the car. Ikea, and customer furniture makers, are now building wireless chargers into their furniture. Again, it’s the convenience. Charging by wire right now is still the fastest, most efficient way to get power into your battery. In five years, I expect that wireless charging will be the dominant mode. If Starbucks can more a little faster on building the chargers into all their stores, it might happen even quicker. It’s slow. Fast charge can provide 2.5A or more, but Qi is typically 0.5A to 2A… although this can decrease battery deterioration.It creates some waste heat. Lithium batteries deteriorate faster if they’re charged while hot.If you don’t have a well-shaped wireless charging pad, the phone may charge intermittently, get warmer than usual, or get accidentally bumped off before the charge is complete.You can find chargers and cords everywhere. Wireless chargers are not as easy to find and they’re more expensive.Having USB chargers in homes and businesses enables nearly everyone to charge. Having wireless chargers doesn’t help others nearly as often.It’s not nearly as convenient to use a wireless charger while also using the phone.
